original: Håkansson, Bror Gustaf Melcher, kommini^ster, Göteborg, f. 18/7/97 i G’bg av fastigh :äg. Gustaf H. o. Hanna Bergström. G. 35 m. Gerd Andersson. Barn: Ingrid f. 36, Bertil 40, Margareta 42. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 18, teol. fil. ex. 21, teol. kand. o. prakt, teol. prov 27, prästv. f. Gbgs stift 28. Studires. t. Tyskl. 32, Finl. 33, Tyskl. o. Ital. 34. V. pastor i Berghem 28, Dalstorp s. å., V. Frölunda 29, Mölndal 30, v. kommin. i Starrkärr 30, v. pastor i Skredsvik s. å., kyrkoadj. i Carl Johans förs. i Gbg 31, kommin. i V. Frölunda sed. 38. Ordf. i Kyrkl. friv:kåren i Lund 26 o. 27, sekr. i Carl Johans förs. diakoniråd 31-38, Kungsladugårds kapellfören. o. stift. 34-38, led. av skolnd, ordf. i Älvsb. kyrkl. ungd:krets, Älvsb. kyrkl. sondagssk.. Minnesgården, fören. f. sjöm :vård, Älvsb. diakonikrets o. Älvsb. jultomtar. M^edarb. i Gbgs Morgonpost 33-34.
translated: Hakansson, Bror Gustaf Melcher, clergyman, Gothenburg, born on July 18, 1897 in Gothenburg to property owner Gustaf H. and Hanna Bergström. Married in 1935 to Gerd Andersson. Children: Ingrid b. 1936, Bertil b. 1940, Margareta b. 1942. He graduated from high school in Gothenburg in 1918, received a degree in theology in 1921, passed practical theological exams in 1927, and was ordained as a priest in the Gothenburg diocese in 1928. He studied abroad in Germany in 1932, Finland in 1933, and Germany and Italy in 1934. He was a vicar in Berghem in 1928, Dalstorp in the same year, in Västra Frölunda in 1929, in Mölndal in 1930, a curate in Starrkärr in 1930, a vicar in Skredsvik in the same year, a church administrative assistant in Carl Johans församling in Gothenburg in 1931, and a curate in Västra Frölunda from 1938. He was chairman of the Church Volunteer Corps in Lund in 1926 and 1927, secretary of the diocesan council in Carl Johans församling from 1931 to 1938, and a member of the school board and chairman of the young church circle in Älvsborg. He was also involved in several other organizations including the Memory Foundation, the Association for Seamen's Care, Älvsborg Diaconate Circle, and Älvsborg Santas. He was also a contributor to Goteborgs Morgonpost from 1933 to 1934.

structured.name: Bror Gustaf Melcher Hakansson
structured.description: Bror Gustaf Melcher Hakansson was a Swedish clergyman born on July 18, 1897 in Gothenburg. He was the son of property owner Gustaf H. and Hanna Bergström, and was married to Gerd Andersson in 1935. They had three children: Ingrid, Bertil, and Margareta. Bror Hakansson graduated from Gothenburg High School in 1918 and received his Bachelor of Arts in Theology from the Theological Seminary in 1921. He passed practical theological exams in 1927 and was ordained as a priest in the Gothenburg Diocese in 1928. Bror Hakansson served as vicar in Berghem, Dalstorp, Västra Frölunda, Mölndal, and Skredsvik, as well as a curate in Starrkärr and a church administrative assistant in Carl Johans församling in Gothenburg before becoming a curate in Västra Frölunda in 1938. He was also involved in several organizations including the Church Volunteer Corps in Lund, diocesan council in Carl Johans församling, and the Memory Foundation and Association for Seamen's Care in Älvsborg.
